intro: Calandrinia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are often pink or red, and it blooms during the warmer months. Calandrinia weberbaueri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
